title: Donny and Marie Osmond are honored with their own star on the Las Vegas Walk of Stars
text:
All great things must come to an end.

And after 11 years, household names Donny and Marie Osmond will be ending their residency at the Flamingo Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada next month.

On Friday, they were seen outside the venue of their long-running show, at an unveiling ceremony in their honor for their very own star on the Las Vegas Walk of Stars.

Stars: Donny and Marie Osmond were seen outside the venue of their long-running show, at an unveiling ceremony for their very own star on the Las Vegas Walk of Stars on Friday

Donny, 61, and Marie, 59, have been a brother-and-sister entertaining duo for decades, which has mostly comprised singing but also a fair share of talk and variety show hosting gigs.

The pair were all smiles on Friday, with Marie in an elegant knotted brown midi dress, and Donny in a relaxed black tuxedo over an open-collared black dress shirt.

They laughed and embraced during the presentation, and looked truly elated by the honor.

The Talk host and former Tiger Beat heartthrob also posed with city and local officials under a giant marquee billboard for their show, which read 'Donny & Marie voted #1 three years in a row'.

Gracious: The pair were all smiles on Friday, with Marie in an elegant knotted brown midi dress, and Donny in a relaxed black tuxedo over an open-collared black dress shirt

The siblings' older brother Alan Osmond, with whom Donny performed as part of the popular singing group The Osmonds in the 1970s, was also there in support of his brother and sister.

As reported by CNN and Entertainment Tonight, Donny and Marie's decision to end their successful Vegas run is motivated by their desire to each pursue separate projects.

Marie is making a return to acting this year after some time away from the craft, in the upcoming holiday TV movie The Road Home For Christmas.

Vegas institutions: The Talk host and former Tiger Beat heartthrob also posed with city and local officials under a giant marquee billboard for their show

Older brother: The siblings' 70-year-old brother Alan Osmond, with whom Donny performed as part of the popular singing group The Osmonds in the 1970s, was also there

Donny, who was the Peacock on the first season of The Masked Singer, is also a regular on The Talk like his sister.

This week on the CBS morning show, host Marie took the opportunity to open up about her son Michael's suicide in 2010, a topic she had largely remained closed about beforehand.

On Tuesday's episode, Marie spoke about how the teen had been bullied by other kids right up until his death when he was attending college in Los Angeles.

Donny and Marie's show at the Flamingo in Las Vegas runs up until November 16.

Moving on: Donny and Marie's decision to end their successful Vegas run is motivated by their desire to each pursue separate projects
description: After an incredible 11 years, household names Donny and Marie Osmond will be ending their residency at the Flamingo Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada next month.
